original: NON COMPETITION  AGREEMENT  AND  RIGHT  OF FIRST  OFFER THIS  AGREEMENT  is dated  May 3,2006.
ollama_generated:
POST-EMPLOYMENT RESTRICTIONS AND RIGHT OF FIRST REFUSAL

This agreement, governing Post-Employment Restrictions and the Right of First Refusal, is effective as of May 3, 2006.

Under this agreement, upon the termination of your employment, you shall not engage in any competitive activities within the same industry for a period of two years. However, the scope of this restriction is narrowed to geographical areas where our company has a minimal presence or where the provision of your services would not reasonably be expected to harm our legitimate business interests.

Additionally, should you choose to leave our company, we reserve the right to match any offer made by another employer within the same industry and geographic area for up to six months following your departure. If we exercise this right, you shall have the option to remain employed with us at a comparable position and compensation package.

This agreement is binding upon both parties and shall be governed by the laws of the jurisdiction in which our company is headquartered. Any amendments or modifications must be made in writing and signed by authorized representatives from both parties.

original: GLAMIS  GOLD  LTD.,  a company  incorporated  under  the laws of the Province  of British  Columbia,  having  an office  at 310-5190 Neil Road,  Reno,  Nevada  89502 (“Glam  is”) WESTERN  COPPER CORPORATION,  a company incorporated  under the laws of the Province  of British  Columbia, having  an office at 2050-1111  West Georgia  Street, Vancouver.
ollama_generated: WESTERN COPPER CORPORATION, a company incorporated under the laws of the Province of British Columbia, with its main office located at 2050-1111 West Georgia Street, Vancouver ("Western"), hereby assumes primary responsibility for any and all liabilities arising from this agreement. In the event that GLAMIS GOLD LTD., a company incorporated under the laws of the Province of British Columbia, with its principal office at 310-5190 Neil Road, Reno, Nevada 89502 ("Glam"), incurs any such liabilities, Western shall indemnify and hold harmless Glam to the fullest extent permitted by law.

ollama_generated: Interpretation 1.2 In this Agreement, except as explicitly stated otherwise or where the context requires a different interpretation, (a) the terms "this Agreement", "hereof", "herein", "hereunder" and similar expressions refer to this Agreement as it stands at any given time, including but not limited to any amendments or supplements made under the provisions of this Agreement, and not to any specific section or other part, 1162967.3 (b) a reference to a Part means a Part of this Agreement, and the symbol § followed by a number or combination of numbers and letters refers to the provision so designated in this Agreement, and the symbol § followed by a letter within a provision refers to a clause within such provision, (c) the headings used in this Agreement are for convenience only and do not form a part of this Agreement; they are not intended to restrict, define or limit the scope, extent, or intent of this Agreement or any provision hereof, (d) the word "including", when following any general statement, term, or matter, is not meant to be limiting. Rather, it is intended to allow such general statement, term, or matter to refer to all other items or matters that could reasonably fall within its broadest possible scope, (e) if any date on which an action is required to be taken under this Agreement falls on a non-business day, such action will not be required until the next business day, and (f) words referring to the masculine gender include the feminine or neutral gender, and words in the singular include the plural and vice versa.

original: Subsidiaries  and Affiliates 1.3 Bach of the parties hereto agree that all of their covenants,  agreements  and obligations  hereunder  shall extend  to and be binding  upon and may be enforced  against  any and all of their respective  subsidiaries  and other  Affiliates,  as well as against  the parties  themselves, as the case may be, and that the names  of Glamis  and Western  Copper  will herein  be deemed  to refer collectively  to Glamis  and all of its subsidiaries  and other  Affiliates  and to Western  Copper and all of its subsidiaries  and other  Affiliates,  respectively.
ollama_generated: Parties 1.3 of this Agreement acknowledge that each party's obligations, commitments, and covenants as stated herein shall also apply to and be enforceable against any and all subsidiaries or Affiliates they may possess at the time of enforcement. This obligation extends not only to the parties themselves but also to their respective subsidiaries and Affiliates, on a case-by-case basis. It is understood that the terms "Glamis" and "Western Copper", within this agreement, will collectively refer to Glamis Corporation and its subsidiaries, as well as Western Copper Corporation and its subsidiaries, respectively. However, it should be noted that the responsibilities and obligations under this Agreement are primarily those of the individual parties, with their subsidiaries or Affiliates being bound only where expressly stated.

original: ENFORCEMENT Glamis ’ Remedies  for Breach 3.1 Western  Copper  acknowledges  and agrees  that a breach  of its covenants  contained in this Agreement  would  result in damage  to Glamis  that could not adequately  be compensated for by monetary  award  alone, Accordingly,  Western  Copper  agrees  that in the event  of any such breach,  in addition  to any other remedies  available  to Glamis  at law or otherwise,  Glamis  will be entitled,  as a matter  of right and without  the need to prove damage,  to apply to a court of competent  jurisdiction  for relief  by way of injunction,  restraining  order, decree  or otherwise  as may be appropriate  to ensure compliance  by Western  Copper  with the provisions  of this Agreement  and to restrain  any breach  of this Agreement  by Western  Copper, Any remedy expressly  set forth in this §3.1 wall be in addition  to and not inclusive  of or dependent  upon the exercise  of any other  remedy  available  to Glamis  at law or otherwise.
ollama_generated:
ENFORCEMENT Remedies for Default by Western Copper 3.1

Glamis acknowledges and agrees that a default on Western Copper's obligations, as defined within this Agreement, may cause irreparable harm to Glamis which cannot be fully compensated through monetary damages alone. Consequently, Western Copper agrees that in the event of any such default, in addition to any other remedies available to Glamis at law or otherwise, Glamis will have the right, without having to prove actual damages, to petition a court of competent jurisdiction for equitable relief. This may include, but is not limited to, injunctions, restraining orders, decrees, or any other appropriate measures to compel Western Copper's compliance with this Agreement and prevent any breach by Western Copper. It is understood that the remedies outlined in this Section 3.1 are cumulative and additional to, not exclusive of or dependent upon, any other remedy available to Glamis at law or otherwise.

original: Western  Copper ’s Remedies  for Breach 3.2 Glamis  acknowledges  and agrees  that a breach  of its covenants  contained  in this Agreement  would  result  in damage  to Western  Copper  that could  not adequately  be compensated 1162967.3 ibr by monetary  award  alone. Accordingly,  Glamis  agrees  that in the event  of any such breach, in addition  to any other remedies  available  to Western  Copper  at law or otherwise,  Western Copper  will be entitled,  as a matter  of right and without  the need to prove  damage,  to apply  to a court of competent  jurisdiction  for relief by way of injunction,  restraining  order, decree or otherwise  as may be appropriate  to ensure  compliance  by Glamis  with the provisions  of this Agreement  and to restrain  any breach  of this Agreement  by Glamis. Any remedy  expressly  set forth in this §3.2 will be in addition  to and not inclusive  of or dependent  upon the exercise  of any other  remedy  available  to Western  Copper  at law or otherwise Restrictions  Reasonable 3.3 Each  of Western  Copper  and Glamis  agree  that all restrictions  in this Agreement applicable  to them  are reasonable  and valid,  and all defences  to the strict  enforcement  thereof  by Western  Copper  or Glamis,  as the case may be, arc hereby  waived  by them.
ollama_generated:
3.2 Remedies for Breach by Glamis: Western Copper acknowledges and consents that a breach of its obligations under this Agreement may cause irreparable harm to Western Copper that cannot be fully compensated through monetary damages. Consequently, in the event of such breach, Glamis agrees that Western Copper shall have, beyond any other legal remedies, the right to seek relief from a court of competent jurisdiction without having to prove the extent of damages. This right includes, but is not limited to, applying for injunctions, restraining orders, decrees, or any other appropriate relief to enforce compliance with this Agreement by Glamis and prevent any breach by Glamis. The remedies specified in this section 3.2 are supplementary and do not exclude, limit, or depend on the exercise of any other remedy available to Western Copper at law or otherwise.

3.3 Reasonable Restrictions: Each of Western Copper and Glamis acknowledges that all restrictions imposed upon them under this Agreement are reasonable and valid. However, each party reserves the right to challenge the enforcement of these restrictions should they deem it necessary, without waiving their rights or obligations under this Agreement in doing so.

Dale Corman (b) Any  such notice,  direction  or other  instrument,  whether  delivered  or transmitted by facsimile  transmission,  will be deemed  to have been given  at the time and on the date on which  it was delivered  to or received  in the office  of the addressee,  as the case may be, if delivered  or transmitted  prior to 5:00 p.m. (Pacific  time)  on a Business  Day or at 9:00 a.m. (Pacific  time) on the next succeeding  Business  Day if delivered  or transmitted subsequent  to such  time;
modified:
Suite 2050-1111, West Georgia Street Vancouver, B.C V6E 4M3, Attention: F. Dale Corman (b) Any such notice, direction, or other instrument, whether delivered or transmitted electronically, will be deemed to have been received, and therefore taken into account, at the addressee's discretion, if received in the office of the recipient during regular business hours on a Business Day. If received outside of these hours, it will be deemed to have been received at 9:00 a.m. (Pacific time) on the next following Business Day. In such cases, it is understood that the recipient may choose to defer action until the next Business Day if they deem it necessary.

In this revised clause, the sender no longer has a specific window of time for the receipt of documents before they are considered received. Instead, the recipient now has the discretion to defer action if received outside of regular business hours, potentially shifting responsibility or requiring further communication.
